Template scaffold should be installed in the configured source directory
No more bundle exec thank you

Add UTF-8 encoding to avoid issues on Ruby 1.9

Merge pull request #26 from octopress/docs-command

Add docs command for Octopress
Added dependencies on octopress-ink and octopres-codefence to make fancy Ink docs work

Now serving plugin documentation.

When octopress docs is run from within a Jekyll site, it will require
all plugins listed in the _config.yml gems array, ensuring that any
Octopress Ink plugins in the gems array will be able to add their
documentation assets to the octopress docs site.
Added support for octopress-config option and docs_mode

Merge pull request #20 from octopress/new-command

Improved new post/page template options.
Raise is irritating and noisy. Abort instead.
The regex for detecting YAML front matter should now meet @parkr's standards.
Now docs requires the --jekyll flag to render jekyll docs

Improved new post/page template options.

1. Now users can set in _octopress.yml

```
new_post_template: post
new_page_template: page
```

Now when a user runs `octopress new post`, the template for a new post
will be read in from `[source]/_templates/post`. Of course you can have
a file extension if you like, but no file extension is
necessary since there is a default file extension for posts and pages
and that will be used regardless of what the template file is.

2. Now the template will only parse the YAML front-matter in Liquid.

This means that users can add any content they like after the yaml front
matter and it will not be parsed until it is built with Jekyll. This
means that liquid variables, tags will be preserved.
Helpers -> CommandHelpers because I'd rather be specific and leave room for Helpers someday.
Added Jekyll commmands build, serve, doctor, docs
Fixed path for new pages. Removed test files I didn't want.
